titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Samplified Digital Recording Studios Records
titlestmt.author: Stacey Lavender

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoded in EAD by Archon 3.21 from an SQL database source on October 14th, 2016.

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Samplified Digital Recording Studios Records 1995/2003

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: This collection contains Alesis Digital Audio Tapes (ADATs), invoices, photographs, and posters from Samplified Digital Recording Studios and is divided into four series: Recordings, Invoices, Promotional Materials, and Photographs.

bioghist.head: Historical Note:
bioghist.p: Engineer Keenan “Maestro” Mosley, born in 1958 and originally from Philadelphia, opened his Samplified Digital Recording Studios in Missouri City around 1990. There he recorded artists such as DJ Screw, K-Rino, Point Blank, BAM, the Terrorists, Klondike Kat, Big 50, and many others. National recording artists such as Run-DMC, Ice T, Master P, and Spice 1 also stopped into Samplified Studios to record while they were performing in Houston. Samplified Digital Recording Studios was in business for over a decade, until it stopped getting clients around 2003. Mosley, who went by the professional name Keenan Lyles, died in 2010 at the age of fifty-two. He was survived by his son Kendall Mosley, who raps as Chane.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accruals.head: Accruals:
accruals.p: Additional materials were acquired from Kendall Mosley on 06/27/2012 and 10/8/2012.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Photocopy decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Samplified Digital Recording Studios Records. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics or Technical Requirements:
phystech.p: Due to the fragility of the original ADATs, they cannot be played directly. Digital copies of the individual audio tracks can be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. These materials may require up to one week to access. Contact Julie Grob (jgrob@uh.edu").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Alesis Digital Audio Tapes (ADATs), invoices, photographs, and posters from Samplified Digital Recording Studios and is divided into four series: Recordings, Invoices, Promotional Materials, and Photographs. The ADATs contain recordings by many prominent Houston hip hop artists, mostly notably several sets of tapes containing master recordings by DJ Screw. Due to the fragility of the original ADATs, they cannot be played directly, but digital access files are available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains 190 Alesis Digital Audio Tapes, or ADATs, recorded at Samplified Studios. ADAT is a magnetic tape format used for the simultaneous digital recording of eight analogue audio or digital audio tracks at once. ADATs became very popular among recording studios in the 1990s due to their high quality and affordability. The tapes in this series contain recordings by many prominent Houston hip hop artists, mostly notably several sets of tapes containing master recordings by DJ Screw. The tapes are arranged alphabetically by artist, and titles were taken directly from the tapes. Due to the fragility of the original ADATs, they cannot be played directly. Digital copies of the individual audio tracks can be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. These materials may require up to one week to access. Contact Julie Grob (jgrob@uh.edu) for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains invoices created by Samplified Digital Recording Studios between 1995 and 1997. Invoices have been left in their original order within the folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Promotional material series is divided into two sub-series by format; Posters and Promo Cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Posters sub-series is arranged alphabetically by the artist or label; most folders contain one to four posters. Most of these posters hung on the walls at Samplified Digital Recording Studios, and many are signed by the artists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is divided into two sub-series: Personal Photographs and Promotional Photographs. The personal photographs sub-series contains photos taken at the studio, and the promotional photographs sub-series contains signed promotional photographs from artists given to the studio.
